GENOCIDAL.Definition: involving the killing of a large number of people from a particular nation

BLOW-BY-BLOW.Definition: giving all the details in the order in which they happened

HOLOCAUST.Definition: the mass murder of Jewish people under the German Nazi rule during the period 1941–5

WAVES.Definition: large groups one after the other

POURED INTO.Definition: entered fast and in large numbers

COMPLEX.Definition: a structure consisting of many different and connected parts

MISTRESS.Definition: the woman he had a sexual relation with

WILL.Definition: a legal document containing instructions as to what should be done with his money and property after his death

ALLY.Definition: person who had agreed to help and support him

SLAUGHTER.Definition: killing of a large amount of people

INFANCY.Definition: the time when they were babies

DIALECT.Definition: the form of language that people spoke in that particular part of the country

INHERITANCE.Definition: money or property that was given to him when his father died

CANVAS.Definition: a strong type of cloth used as a surface for painting

WATERCOLOURS.Definition: paintings drawn with paint mixed with water

ESTATE.Definition: his money and property at the time of his death

RUNNER.Definition: a job that involved passing messages between different army units on the front line

ARMISTICE.Definition: formal agreement between the countries at war to stop fighting for a particular time

PROPAGANDA.Definition: information arranged in a way that could affect people's opinions

INFORMER.Definition: a person who gave information in secret

COUP D'ÉTAT.Definition: a sudden and violent removal of a government in order to take its position

COUP.Definition: a sudden and violent removal of a government in order to take its position

HYPERINFLATION.Definition: fast and out-of-control general price increases in the economy

RHETORIC.Definition: language designed to have a persuasive or impressive effect

HINT.Definition: small piece of information that suggested it

OBSESSIVE.Definition: unable to stop thinking about it

OBSESSIVENESS.Definition: the fact that he was extremely interested in her

ON THE CUSP OF.Definition: at the point when he was about to have it

SCANDAL.Definition: an action that would cause public feelings of shock and anger

SHY.Definition: nervous and uncomfortable with other people

AMBITIOUS.Definition: having a strong wish to be successful

CONSCRIPTION.Definition: the process of forcing people by law to join the army

SYNAGOGUES.Definition: buildings in which Jewish people practised their religion

ROUNDED UP.Definition: gathered or collected in one place

DO JUSTICE TO.Definition: treat it in an appropriate, deserving way

SACRIFICING.Definition: killing for the sake of something he considered more important

SLAUGHTERING.Definition: killing (for a large amount of people)

BRIEFCASE.Definition: a flat bag used for carrying documents

DEPENDENCE.Definition: a situation in which he needed it all the time, addiction

CONSEQUENTIAL.Definition: having the biggest effect or impact
